field.name: loadTwig
field.label: Load Twig
field.description: Controls whether Custom Tables should load the Twig templating engine. Disable this if your template already includes Twig to prevent conflicts. Most templates work fine with Twig enabled, but some specialized templates may require disabling it.

field.name: fieldPrefix
field.label: Field Name Prefix
field.description: Specifies the prefix added to all table field names (e.g., 'ct_FieldName'). This prefix helps prevent conflicts with MySQL reserved words and ensures database compatibility. Only modify this if you have a specific reason to use a different prefix scheme. Type NO-PREFIX to have field names without a prefix. Changing the prefix doesnt automatically renames fields. You will have to do it manually.

field.name: googlemapapikey
field.label: Google Map API Key
field.description: Enter your Google Maps API key to enable map functionality. Required for displaying maps and using location-based features in your tables.

field.name: GoogleDriveAPIKey
field.label: Google Drive API Developer Key
field.description: Enter your Google Drive API Developer Key to enable integration with Google Drive services. Required for accessing and managing files stored in Google Drive.

field.name: GoogleDriveClientId
field.label: Google Drive API ClientID
field.description: Enter your Google Drive API Client ID for authentication. This is required alongside the API Key for secure access to Google Drive services.

field.name: chatgptapikey
field.label: ChatGPT API Key
field.description: Enter your OpenAI API key to enable ChatGPT integration. This key is required to use AI-powered features within the Custom Tables ChatGPT module, such as content generation and data analysis.

field.name: toolbaricons
field.label: Toolbar Icons
field.description: Choose the icon style for your toolbar interface. - Image Icons: Uses PNG/JPG files for maximum compatibility. - Font Awesome: A modern, scalable icon library (version 4, 5, or 6). Ensure your template supports the selected version. - Bootstrap Icons: Alternative vector icons available in some Joomla templates. - Recommended: Font Awesome 6 (for Joomla 5+) or Bootstrap if your template does not use Font Awesome.

field.name: folderToSaveLayouts
field.label: Folder where to save Layouts
field.description: Specify a folder path where layout files should be stored on the server. This allows you to version control your layouts and edit them directly using your preferred text editor. Leave empty to store layouts in the database.
